name: Paul Coverdell National Acute Stroke Program National Center for Chronic Disease Prevention and Health Promotion
objective: To improve the quality of acute stroke care and health outcomes for acute stroke patients.  Program activities will address the continuum of care from onset of stroke through rehabilitation and recovery, focusing on health systems change and community and clinical linkages.
top_agency_name: Department of Health and Human Services
sub_agency_name: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
applicant_types: State (includes District of Columbia, public institutions of higher education and hospitals)

authorizations.text: This program is authorized under Section 317 of the Public Health Services Act (PHS Act), 42 U.S.C. 247b(k)(2) as amended.
